summary: A pull list starter kit for Carol Danvers
title: A pull list starter kit for Carol Danvers
excerpt: Carol Danvers is about to make her big-screen debut next year as Captain Marvel in Marvel’s first female-led film, and we can’t wait to see our girl fighting Skrulls in the ‘90s set to what we’re guessing is going to be an amazing soundtrack. While we await the magic, though, there’s a whole slew of Carol Danvers stories in the Marvel comics universe dating all the way back to her first appearance in 1968.

blog.description: I like Diana and Tony and Rhodey and Gamora and Brunnhilde and Sam and Anakin and Ahsoka and Leia and Padme and Luke and Han and Arya and Sansa and Daenerys and Gendry and Jon and Arianne and Victoria and Leah and Rosalie and Kassandra and Luna and Harry and Ginny and

summary: who should be the one to reverse the snap in a4 and why
body:
who should be the one to reverse the snap in a4 and why

1. Nebula

Why? Because we know she’s still alive. Because she deserves to realize that despite what little value Thanos saw in her and how little he cared for her, she has more potential and value than he ever would, not just because she is strong enough to defeat him, but because she can defeat him by saving lives wheras he could only achieve through murder and cruelty, and what better way to prove that to herself than by using the powers he’d sought and used for genocide to bring people to life and reunite them with their loved ones. Because Nebula has been consistently cast off and utilized by the narrative because she is an augmented victim of abuse and torture, and what better way than to reverse that typical narrative than by giving her character the opportunity to save other victims, the ultimate demonstration of agency.

2. Gamora

Why? Because of everything stated in the above paragraph, minus the augmentation and knowing she’s alive part. Because we followed her emotional arc right up until and even, arguably, through her death scene, and her return to defeat Thanos would be the ultimate cinematic triumph. Because Zoe Saldana gave, in my opinion, the most riveting performance in all of IW. Because her return to defeat Thanos would also be the best way to undermine the validation of Thanos’s abusive behavior in IW, by showing that love means nothing if you don’t choose to prioritize it, and that Gamora is more than just a sacrifice to be made for Thanos’s ambitions.

3. Mantis

Because of near everything stated in the first paragraph, minus the augmentation and knowing she’s alive part. Because Mantis proved her power in IW when she managed to use her powers to weaken Thanos the way she did for as long as she did. Because Mantis has first hand experience deliving into the psyche of a destructive abusers who treat their children as mere extensions of themselves, and entire planets and species as pawns, just like Thanos, so she knows how a mind like that works and how to disrupt it.

4. Carol Danvers

Because she is the most powerful character in the MCU. Because purporting to have a female character representing the new era of your franchise is great, but actual follow-through in her position in the narrative - driving the plot, maintaining her actual relevance to the story - is necessary for the representation to mean anything. Because, (ref to Wisecrack’s episode on IW and why Iron Man and Captain America’s teams both failed, which is fantastic, and likely better than any way I could explain it), her approach to battle appears to tie together rationalism and romanticism in a way both our heroes have failed before.

5. Tony Stark

Because we need him to win. Because the audience has identified with Tony’s emotional and moral transformation, growth, and rebirth (yes, I’d have to say his arc comprises of all three forms) and tied it to their own ability to be redeemed. Because the parallels between Thanos and Tony are intentional and to fully explore their relationships as foils, Tony needs to be critical for Thanos’s downfall and instrumental in the reversal of Thanos’s defining victory 

(the snap). Because (ref again to WC’s vid) in order to complete Tony Stark’s evolution from robotic rationalist using defense mechanisms to protect himself and others and successful missions to measure his redemption to a human, who has accepted that the path to redeeming oneself can involve making himself vulnerable to those who care, and contributing to the world through living his life creating a legacy for heroes like Peter to pick up, and not just through sacrificing himself and what he wants supposedly in the name of a rational greater good.

6. Shuri or Nakia (as the Black Panther)

Because I want them to be more prominent in the franchise, and quite frankly it’d be cool to see a female take up the Black Panther mantle until T’Challa is brought back to reclaim it. Because it would piss off the .02% of humans who believed that Black Panther was a fluke and they would be able to watch their white faves save the day from now on with no worries.

7. Thor

Because it’s be so cool. Fuck, it’d be so cool. Hammer + Gauntlet? Man, I love Thor.

8. Jessica Jones

Because she’s got good experience killing controlling, abusive purple assholes who kidnap women to fulfill their desire for a twisted parody of a relationship/family, and I think she, Gamora, and Nebula should start a club.

tags: i know im gonna get a lot of hate for this but i’m tired of all this love for a character no one has even seen yet onscreen
why all the avengers have to die to bring her in
why can’t we have all of them
body:
Marvel rant!

Okay I know everyone is sooo excited for Captain Marvel. But I’m just.. not? Cause I know she’s replacing Captain America and I’m not okay. It’s like everyone is already on board with her taking over. They are gonna get rid of Iron Man and Captain America and all the originals and bringing in new people I’m not okay. Same with DC, getting rid of Superman and bringing in Supergirl. And Marvel killing Loki like that? Is so beyond wrong. I can’t even get started on that. They did Loki dirty and I will never forgive that. I can’t even bring myself to watch Infinity War again because of that. But everyone is already calling Captain Marvel the strongest and it’s like everyone is so ready to bring all the current superheroes down to bring her up. We arlready had REALLY strong heroes. Thor, Loki, Scarlett Witch. But they down play them. Like crazy and what Captain Marvel is just gonna swoop in and save the day. I’m sorry but I don’t buy it.

summary: 'Marvel Rising: Secret Warriors' trailer features Marvel's most diverse onscreen team ever
title: 'Marvel Rising: Secret Warriors' trailer features Marvel's most diverse onscreen team ever
body:
If you’ve wondered what the next generation of Marvel heroes looks like, here’s your answer. Marvel Rising: Secret Warriors, an 80-minute animated film premiering this month on the Disney Channel, aims to capture a tween audience with an ensemble of diverse, dynamic young superheroes. Watch Yahoo Entertainment’s exclusive trailer above.

The characters in Marvel Rising: Secret Warriors will be new to a lot of viewers, but they’re already familiar to Marvel comics fans. The trailer opens with a conversation between Ms. Marvel, a Pakistani-American teen with body-morphing powers, and Squirrel Girl, a computer genius with a squirrel sidekick and the proportional abilities of a squirrel. Under the tutelage of original Ms. Marvel Carol Danvers, who now goes by Captain Marvel (and will be played by Brie Larson in the upcoming feature film Captain Marvel), the girls form an “unofficial team” with other teenage supers. These include Quake, a girl who can produce earth-shaking vibrations (and has played a major role in the Marvel TV series Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.); America Chavez, an ultra-powerful female hero with near-invulnerability and flying powers; Patriot, an African-American teen whose powers mirror those of Captain America; Ghost Spider, the arachnid-charged heroine formerly known as Gwen Stacy; and Inferno, a Latinx mutant who can generate fire from thin air.

The film is the latest installment of Disney’s Marvel Rising franchise, which so far has included comics and a series of animated prequel shorts (viewable on the Marvel HQ YouTube channel).

Along with the animated franchise, Marvel and Disney will launch a complementary series of merchandise, from action figures and apparel to web-shooters and walkie-talkies, that will be available exclusively at Target in October. Here’s a sampling:

Marvel Rising: Secret Warriors premieres on Disney Channel and Disney XD on Sept. 30 at 10 p.m. ET/PT.

Read more from Yahoo Entertainment:

  • Here’s your exclusive first look at Disney’s ‘Black Panther’ animated series
  • Riz Ahmed on why a South Asian woman should write ‘Ms. Marvel’
  • Why ‘Ant-Man and the Wasp’ doesn’t acknowledge events of ‘Infinity War’ until… (SPOILERS!)

Marvel Rising: Secret Warriors, an 80-minute animated film premiering this month on the Disney Channel, aims to capture a tween audience with an ensemble of diverse, dynamic young superheroes. Watch Yahoo Entertainment’s exclusive trailer above.

The characters in Marvel Rising: Secret Warriors will be new to a lot of viewers, but they’re already familiar to Marvel comics fans. The trailer opens with a conversation between Ms. Marvel, a Pakistani-American teen with body-morphing powers, and Squirrel Girl, a computer genius with a squirrel sidekick and the proportional abilities of a squirrel. Under the tutelage of original Ms. Marvel Carol Danvers, who now goes by Captain Marvel (and will be played by Brie Larson in the upcoming feature film Captain Marvel), the girls form an “unofficial team” with other teenage supers. These include Quake, a girl who can produce earth-shaking vibrations (and has played a major role in the Marvel TV series Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.); America Chavez, an ultra-powerful female hero with near-invulnerability and flying powers; Patriot, an African-American teen whose powers mirror those of Captain America; Ghost Spider, the arachnid-charged heroine formerly known as Gwen Stacy; and Inferno, a Latinx mutant who can generate fire from thin air.

The film is the latest installment of Disney’s Marvel Rising franchise, which so far has included comics and a series of animated prequel shorts (viewable on the Marvel HQ YouTube channel).

Along with the animated franchise, Marvel and Disney will launch a complementary series of merchandise, from action figures and apparel to web-shooters and walkie-talkies, that will be available exclusively at Target in October. Here’s a sampling:

The 11-inch poseable figures include Ms. Marvel, Daisy Johnson (aka Quake) Patriot, America Chavez, Squirrel Girl, Ghost-Spider, and Inferno. Each will cost $19.99. (Photo: Hasbro)Marvel Rising: Secret Warrior figures (Photos: Hasbro)Ms. Marvel, Squirrel Girl, and Ghost-Spider costumes (Photos: Disney Consumer Products)Apparel ranges from graphic hoodie/jogger pants combo to Squirrel Girl hoodie to ¾ T-shirts to Ms. Marvel short-sleeve dress. (Photos: Disney Consumer Products)

Marvel Rising: Secret Warriors premieres on Disney Channel and Disney XD on Sept. 30 at 10 p.m. ET/PT.

Read more from Yahoo Entertainment:

  • Here’s your exclusive first look at Disney’s ‘Black Panther’ animated series
  • Riz Ahmed on why a South Asian woman should write ‘Ms. Marvel’
  • Why ‘Ant-Man and the Wasp’ doesn’t acknowledge events of ‘Infinity War’ until… (SPOILERS!)

summary: since we been getting first looks at captain marvel and you love both   Carol and Diana. Do you have any headcannons. How they...
question: since we been getting first looks at captain marvel and you love both   Carol and Diana. Do you have any headcannons. How they would meet? would they meet as CM and WW first or as Carol and Diana?
answer:
OMG I’ve actually talked about this before! Lol. Well for starters, Carol doesn’t have a secret identity. At least not in the comics. She’s publicly known. I feel like they’d probably meet doing something hero-related. Carol can be hot-headed so Diana would most likely roll her eyes at her a lot but as heroes they have a lot in common. Both having such intense powers but leading with their humanity and all that.

And Carol is a stubborn American pilot with Captain before her name. Diana’s dealt with one of those before. (And fallen in love with them. ;) )
